column5: Kinda like a good beer ( Stella ) vrs a $ 1 beer.  tb

That's nuts, no wonder they are folding like a cheap suit across the states...Any time the gf comment about my fishing gear i just tell her, "I could be a drug addict, instead I enjoy fishing. If you want I could sell all my gear and try crack or crystal meth." She just rolls her eyes and doesn't say anything

still 15,000 plus locations world wide . 900 closures had a lot to do with some bad location choices .Growing too fast at 1200 plus new locations a year in US alone. The US economy in particular has bashed many a company .  Still on a strong growth curve here in Canada ...keeps me in Rods and reels  TB

If she's admitting to a couple of these a day, you can bet it's usually more. I think you can easily up that total to $300+. ..........and don't forget to add the cost of fuel if she has to drive there. +$+$+$+$+$..........  I don't get it !!!     Is it really this easy to get people to part with their money ?
It's purses for my wife, Why anyone would need so many is beyond me

Starbucks is just crazy man, i used to take my gf there and 2 drinks were never less then 10 bucks and i remember thinking, i can buy 2 lures for this much but never really said anything to her lol. 1.50 for a large coffee sounds affordable and timms makes good coffee

Anyone who has been suckered into thinking Starbucks' drinks are actually worth the price they charge needs to give their head a shake.  Hard.  I can only remember ever having Starbucks' one time.  A guy at a job site did a coffee run and came back with some sort of pumpkin something latte/coffee.  See, I don't even know what it was other than if you throw enough words into the name and confuse ppl you can charge more!  I don't even remember if it was decent, just that I was like, "what the heck is this?" when it was handed to me.

Sorry to bring the discussion back to wives, as long as my better half thinks my $180 rod & reel was bought for $40   she's okay with it.  Rule of thumb here is what she doesn't know is not gonna hurt her, and what I don't know about how much she spends on shoes, dresses, & what-not ain't hurting me!  It's mutual bliss, so to speak.  Os

I always bought coffee every morning, I preferred country style over timmies anyday (Too bad there is none in my area since moving).  I spent a few bucks everyday on coffee, and if I was getting one around lunchtime I would often get a bagel with it.  It adds up very quickly, but my argument was I don't smoke so I should be able to treat myself to my coffee.  That's a terrible way to look at it for anyone else who does.  You still spend a lot of $ with nothing to show for it.  Not to mention coffee isn't exactly the healthiest choice.  I buy tim hortons coffee & brew it myself now instead (If you figure out the right combination of coffee to water it tastes just as good).  I've never done the math but I save a lot of money.  I also drink green tea two or three times a day to avoid drinking as much, I love it.
I married Emilda Marcos! HH
Yah... but she's letting you go fishing next Thursday ! lol

The wife does not ask what I paid for things if she does I tell her then next time she remembers and does not ask or just goes with it I am very lucky as she also loves to get out fishing all the time so there is really no questions as its for teh family and for our 6th anniversary she loved her new Okuma Convector 30D reel and musky rod that matched the other 3 (WE) had its all good around here.  I also dont ask about the three sewing machines and cooking stuff she wants I just go and get it I know it will all get good use alot more then coffee or BINGO like a buddies wife does.
Don't get into arguing who spends  more on what and what is 'useless' or ' waste of Money'  For you will Lose !  TB Advise from someone 21 years married
Wayne, the furlow I obtained from the Warden was hard earned and well deserved... ok, she just didn't want to hear me wimper for four days! LOL HH

Head hunter , I knew we had some  things in common BUT I didnt know you where my brother in law , my wife has more shoes than I have guitars , we have a shoe closet yes a 7 foot x 4 foot walk in just for her shoes lol.

Thanks for the chuckles......  Second Cup, Lg Mocha Chillatte, no whip would be my weakness, around $5.   Cannot duplicate it at home and it is cheaper than therapy  LOL   The fishing budget in this house definitely exceeds the fu fu coffee one

Hey Capt Bruce! Or should I say Hey Bro! LOL I've actually been able to get her to pair them down alot, we are currently sitting at around 55 to 6o pairs! I can't bare to count the boots!!! I'd love to have as many guitars as she has footware! HH
you could always just make your own at home and put this in it.....
The Mrs. Doesn't complain about my fishing "habit". In fact, she goes out and buys me a lot of the gear.  I just have to shut my yap about the Bingo parlours.

i often wonder if i am selfish for spending thousands a year on my passion for fishing.....that all ends today!!!!!  My wife wanted a fu fu coffee drink from star bucks so off i went the good hubby getting her a fu fu drink.  $4.15 later what the hell. I casually ask her how many of these she has and she tells me a couple a day lol do the math it may be more then what i spend on fishing lol  I will never feel guilty again!!!!!!  Cheers!
If I had a Second Cup or Starbucks within walking distance I'd be in a world of financial hurt.
I think you're in need of a new rod and reel combo after this gruesome discovery  Jacques
You my friend are a very smart man!!!
My wife and I have a rule I dont ask what she spends on Scrap booking and she doesnt ask me how much I spend on fishing
thats 224 a month.     Sounds like a boat payment to me

$ 224.00 a month an in the end she has nothing to show for it .......  :wallbash:    If you spent that on a rod and reel at least at the end of the month you would still have a new rod and reel....  :clapping:
That's why I call it Fourbucks!
lol, nice.
It,s now,  you dont ask me,I dont care what ya do.  Once she ask,s,IM DEAD.
And I though Timmie's was bad at $1.65 for an XL
i agree time for new rod and reel

I know when I had a slight addiction to Starbucks I had something a little extra to show for it... That is why the $5.00 bucks now goes no where but into my pocket... I quit that place when I became enlightened... Dang mirrors!
well....    if you get a rod and reel....she should go out and buy a very nice pair of leather Italian shoes....those last.  (so hard being a woman....definitely a man's world)
Would someone please enlighten me? What's a fu fu coffee? I don't get out much. This stuff had better be good 'cause I pay $1. for my beers!
Hey Roy a fu fu is someone talking with a mouth full, taking a sip of coffee and trying to say tu tu   :lol:
Every once in a while, a starbucks coffee is totally worth it to me.  Great stuff.
I'm glad I don't enjoy that fancy coffee too much.  Nothing beats a black coffee in the morning if you ask me!
yes a new rod and and reel, but what about a fish?  i am just kiddin LunkerBass
i have never had star bucks and dont want to, if you never have any you wont want it
I have a hard enough time parting with a $1.25 at Timmies, when I brew a pot for $0.25. At $4 there better be a solid shot in there.
TB
S.

4 bucks   wicked I ll get my wife one a day wait a few months and tell her . . .  well honey you know those coffees cost a fin a day so add the math sweetie...as I casually slip a new boat brochure under her cup of fu fu !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
